jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us 👇🏼

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.

Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from 0 to $35M ARR in 6 years, without raising a single dollar.

Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.

The role: Product Marketing Manager

We’re looking for a Product Marketing Manager to own how we position and communicate lemlist’s product, turning every feature launch into adoption and revenue growth.

Your mission: make sure every product innovation drives real business impact: more signups, higher activation, stronger retention, while building credibility with our sales audience.

This is a high-impact role within our Marketing team, working directly with our CMO and Product team, and collaborating closely with a strong PMM peer and the Growth team.

You’ll be in the driver’s seat to shape lemlist’s narrative, orchestrate GTM launches, and scale product adoption.

What you’ll do

  • Narrative & Positioning → Work with PMs to define the why behind each feature, and turn it into compelling stories and use cases that resonate with sales teams.

  • GTM Orchestration → Plan and execute go-to-market launches across multiple channels, aligning Product, Growth, and Marketing to maximize adoption.

  • Content & Assets → Own key product marketing deliverables: product pages, newsletters, launch kits, clients success stories, competitive benchmarks, and internal enablement docs.

  • Market & Product Expertise → Be the in-house expert on product, industry trends, and competitors to sharpen our positioning.

→ Check out practical examples of GTM plans and assets here ←

Your first year at lemlist

Months 1–3

  • Dive deep into lemlist: product, personas, competitors.

  • Dive into our GTM process, shadowing our experienced PMM.

  • Contribute to a first product launch: from co-crafting the narrative to supervising the launch of the campaigns the D-day and creating some assets (like product page)

  • Organise and publish your first success story

Months 3–6

  • Lead and own GTM for major feature launches, from narrative to distribution, with strong acquisition a/o adoption KPIs

  • Independently create content such as product pages, playbooks, email campaigns, Social Media posts, and video scripts (youtube long form, ad shorts, looms for users...)

Who you are

  • Ideally based in Paris. Open to candidates based in France, as long as you can join the team in Paris once a month.

  • Fluent in English, with excellent written and spoken communication skills.

  • Experienced → You bring 3+ years of B2B SaaS experience in product marketing ideally with proven GTM success.

  • Storyteller & Strategist → You know how to turn features into simple, compelling narratives, positioning them as tools that help sales teams replicate proven success.

  • Hands-on Marketer → You’re equally comfortable defining positioning and writing product pages or newsletters.

  • Product-curious → You love digging into features, testing workflows, talking to customers and keeping tabs on competitors.

  • Collaborative → You thrive at working cross-functionally with Product, Growth, and Marketing.

  • Growth-minded → You think in terms of metrics: acquisition, activation, adoption.

  • Sales-knowledge → Knowledge of Sales persona and industry (tools/landscape) is a huge plus

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive salary + company bonus (up to 15K€ per year depending on company’s performance)

  • 37 days of holidays/year (+3 additional days offered by lempire)

  • Alan Blue: Comprehensive 100% premium medical coverage for you and your family

  • Swile Meal Tickets: Enjoy daily meal tickets to fuel productivity

  • Navigo Card: Seamless commuting with a 100% covered Navigo card

  • Team building: We all meet once per year at really cool places around the world (check our video here)

  • For Parisians - Wellpass (ex Gymlib)

Recruitment Process

  1. 30 min screen interview with Domitille (CMO) or Victoire (TAM)

  2. Business Case (async.) + 45min live Q&A with Domitille (CMO)

  3. PMM interview with Miha

  4. 30 min interview with Charles, our CEO + 30 min interview with 2 Marketing team members

  5. Reference Check

  6. Offer

jobs.title: Senior Sales / Senior Account Executive - French speaker
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us 👇🏼

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.
Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from 0 to $35M ARR in 6 years, without raising a single dollar.
Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.

This is a highly entrepreneurial job in a company that has grown only in self-service/PLG and is now structuring a sales force.

Please read carefully and only apply if you speak French fluently

Mission

Your mission is to acquire high-quality customers for lemlist - our Sales Engagement Platform - and, more generally, lemlist's product.

You will be in charge of the full sales cycle, including prospection, negotiation, the closing phase, and even customer onboarding.

You will focus on companies with 100 to 1,000 employees in various industries and sales teams between 5 to 100 people in various industries.

You'll be both leveraging Inbound (Demo Requests and Product-Led Sales teams) and Outbound (using lemlist to find prospects) - "eat your own dog's food"

Key Results

After 3 months, you will have

Show you can follow the process and well manage high quality inbound lead

Shown you are capable of building an outbound pipeline and closing some higher velocity deals (5-10 seats)

Closed some Inbound / Product-Led-Sales customers

Overall, generated some revenue

After 12 months, you will have

Achieved quotas for most months

Became an expert with the product

Build relationships with multiple customers, using referrals as a lever to acquire more customers

Skills

Fluency in French

2+ Years of experience in a Sales role as a top performer (top 20%)

Sales expertise: you know how to find prospects, create interest & deliver value, and close deals

Experience in outbound -> Cold call /Cold email / LinkedIn. Being able to generate 50% of your own pipeline

Interest in the Sales stack / Sales automation software is a strong plus

Competitor: you like to play as a team and hate losing/failing

You are a self-starter; you don't need someone on your back to work hard

You are an entrepreneur at heart and will find a way to make things work.
You don't need 100 resources, tools, and people to support you in opening a deal with a prospect and closing it

Why Join lempire?

High-impact role with direct contributions to company growth.

Work in a fast-growing SaaS company with exciting career progression opportunities.

Join a dynamic and passionate team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning.

Interview process

Interview with Victoire (TAM)

Discovery call with Yann (VP sales)

Business Case Debrief of the B-case with Yann or a team member

Interview with Charles (CEO)

Reference check

🎯 If you're ready to drive revenue success, we want to hear from you!

jobs.title: Senior Sales / Senior Account Executive - US
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us 👇🏼

At lemlist, we're a passionate team on a mission to help individuals and businesses grow.

As a B2B SaaS company valued at $150 million, we have a suite of 5 products:

🔵 lemlist: our cold outreach tool, used by 10,000+ users worldwide to find leads & their emails, write campaigns, personalize at scale, and get more customers.

🟠 lemwarm: the 1st deliverability tool on the market that helps users reach their audience’s inboxes.

🔴 lemcal: our scheduling tool allows you to create a personalized booking page and reduce no-shows.

🟣 Taplio & Tweet Hunter: our tools, used by top influencers like Justin Welsh, to build personal brands on LinkedIn & X (formerly Twitter).


lemlist is a fast-growing company with $38M+ in revenue, profitable, and 100% bootstrapped.

Our mantra: Keep growing! We live by it every day.

We are looking for an English native/fluent Sales who will be mostly focusing on the US market, as well as English-speaking prospects in Europe (e.g., GB, DE, UK)

You can work remotely from Americas.

Our offices are in Paris, but we are remote-friendly.

This is a highly entrepreneurial job in a company that has grown only in self-service/PLG and is now structuring a sales force.


Please read carefully and only apply if you are in the LATAM timezone and speak English fluently


Mission

Your mission is to acquire high-quality customers for lemlist - our Sales Engagement Platform - and, more generally, lemlist's product.

You will be in charge of the full sales cycle, including prospection, negotiation, the closing phase, and even customer onboarding.

You will focus on companies with 100 to 1,000 employees in various industries and sales teams with 5 to 50 people in various industries.

You'll be both leveraging Inbound (Demo Requests and Product-Led Sales teams) and Outbound (using lemlist to find prospects) - "eat your own dog's food"


Key Results

After 3 months, you will have

Demonstrated your mastery of the product both in terms of being able to demo it perfectly or

Shown you are capable of building an outbound pipeline and closing some higher velocity deals (5-10 seats)

Closed some Inbound / Product-Led-Sales customers

Overall, generated some revenue

After 12 months, you will have

Achieved quotas for most months

Became an expert with the product

Build relationships with multiple customers, using referrals as a lever to acquire more customers


Skills

Fluency in English

3+ Years of experience in a Sales role as a top performer (top 20%)

Sales expertise: you know how to find prospects, create interest & deliver value, and close deals

Experience in outbound -> Cold call /Cold email / LinkedIn. Being able to generate 50% of your own pipeline

Interest in the Sales stack / Sales automation software is a strong plus

Competitor: you like to play as a team and hate losing/failing

You are a self-starter; you don't need someone on your back to work hard

You are an entrepreneur at heart and will find a way to make things work. You don't need 100 resources, tools, and people to support you in opening a deal with a prospect and closing it


Why Join lemlist?

High-impact role with direct contributions to company growth.

Work in a fast-growing SaaS company with exciting career progression opportunities.

Join a dynamic and passionate team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning.


Interview process

Interview with Victoire (TAM)

Discovery call with Yann (Head of sales)

Business Case Debrief of the B-case with Yann

Interview with Charles (CEO)

Reference check


🎯 If you're ready to drive revenue success, we want to hear from you!

jobs.title: Talent Acquisition Junior
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us 👇🏼

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.

Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from 0 to $35M ARR in 6 years, without raising a single dollar.

Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.

Your Mission

As a Junior Talent Acquisition at lemlist, your mission is to attract, engage, and hire the best talent across both Tech and Business roles to support our fast-paced growth.

You’ll work closely with our Talent team and hiring managers across every department to ensure every new joiner is an exceptional hire.

Your main focus? Hunting top talent — proactively identifying and engaging high-potential candidates through LinkedIn Recruiter and creative sourcing strategies.

And you won’t be alone: our Talent team will guide and mentor you, helping you sharpen your sourcing skills, improve your processes, and grow into a confident, autonomous recruiter.

What you’ll be doing

1. Full-cycle recruitment (360°)

  • Partner with hiring managers to define ideal candidate profiles and hiring needs.

  • Write and post engaging job descriptions that stand out.

  • Source and engage candidates using LinkedIn Recruiter, networks, and communities.

  • Conduct first-round interviews (motivation, culture fit, skill screening).

  • Coordinate the whole interview process to ensure a smooth candidate experience.

  • Support hiring managers throughout the selection and onboarding process.

2. Support the Talent team

  • Collaborate daily with our Talent Acquisition and Hiring Managers.

  • Build and maintain proactive pipelines for future hiring needs.

  • Learn best practices in sourcing, interviewing, and process optimization.

3. Tech & Business balance (50/50)

  • Recruit for both Tech roles and Business roles (e.g. Sales, Marketing, Product, Design, Cx…)

  • Strengthen your understanding of SaaS, product culture, and startup hiring dynamics.

What we’re looking for

  • Around 2-3 years of experience in recruitment (startup or agency).

  • You have proven experience in Tech or Business Hiring.

  • You have experience in fast-paced environments (start-ups/ scale-ups)

  • Experience with sourcing and headhunting, especially using LinkedIn Recruiter.

  • You get shit done, fast, with high quality → You’re a doer.

  • Curious, proactive, and eager to go the extra mile

  • Excellent communication and organization skills.

  • Fluent in French & English.

  • Paris-based will be a plus.

If you read our Culture Manifesto and thought “this is 100% me”, then you’ll thrive in this role.

What’s in it for you

  • Competitive salary

  • Continuous learning — the Talent team will coach and support you to grow fast

  • Have a real impact on lemlist’s growth and culture.

  • Access to best-in-class tools (LinkedIn Recruiter, Ashby, automation stack) and equipment (Macbook, etc.)

  • Gymlib, Swile, + a Navigo fully covered

  • Access to the lemhouse and lemflat

  • Annual team offsite in a fantastic location

Recruitment process

  • Interview with Victoire (Team lead TAM)

  • Async Business case

  • BCase debrief with Mika, CTO and Lucas (Tech recruiter)

  • Meet with the team, Oriane (Chief of Staff)

  • Meet with Charles (CEO)

  • Reference check & offer

jobs.title: IT Admin
jobs.descriptionHtml:
À propos de lemlist

lemlist est une Sales Engagement Platform utilisée par plus de 40 000 équipes commerciales dans le monde pour automatiser et personnaliser leurs campagnes de prospection.

On est une équipe de 140 personnes passionnées, en majorité en full remote, mais notre cœur bat toujours à Paris

Aujourd’hui, on grandit vite, et on a besoin de renforcer notre infrastructure interne pour que tout le monde puisse travailler dans les meilleures conditions possibles.

Ta mission

Tu seras le point de contact principal pour tout ce qui touche à l’IT interne

Tu feras en sorte que les outils de l’entreprise fonctionnent sans friction.

Tu aideras les nouveaux à s’installer rapidement et sans galère.

Tu automatiseras petit à petit les tâches répétitives et amélioreras la documentation.

Ton rôle est simple : rendre la vie plus fluide pour toutes les équipes (Sales, Support, Marketing, Tech…) en prenant en charge les sujets IT qui leur font perdre du temps.

Tes responsabilités principales

  • Support et gestion IT interne

  • Gérer les comptes Google Workspace (création, suppression, habilitations).

  • Aider les équipes sur les accès aux outils (Tailscale, Bravas, outils internes, etc.).

  • Maintenir les postes utilisateurs (Mac principalement) : mises à jour, sécurité, configuration.

  • Assurer la gestion du parc informatique avec notre MDM.

  • Gérer l’onboarding et l’offboarding IT des collaborateurs (matériel, accès, outils).

  • Rédiger et maintenir la documentation interne (Notion).

Sécurité et fiabilité

  • Veiller au respect des bonnes pratiques IT (2FA, gestion des accès, sécurité des postes).

  • Travailler avec l’équipe SRE sur l’automatisation de certains process (scripts, monitoring).

Amélioration continue

  • Identifier les irritants récurrents et proposer des solutions simples.

  • Automatiser progressivement les tâches répétitives

  • Participer à la réflexion sur les outils internes et les process IT.

Profil recherché

Tu es curieux, rigoureux, et tu adores résoudre des problèmes techniques.

Tu as déjà une première expérience (stage ou alternance) en support IT, helpdesk ou administration système.

Tu maîtrises l’environnement MacOS

Tu connais Google Workspace et idéalement des outils comme Tailscale, Slack.

Tu es à l’aise avec l’anglais écrit (nos outils et docs sont en anglais).

Tu es autonome, tu aimes apprendre et documenter ce que tu fais.

Bonus : tu touches un peu à la ligne de commande, au scripting ou tu veux apprendre le DevOps à moyen terme.

Pourquoi nous rejoindre

Une équipe tech exigeante mais bienveillante, qui t’aidera à grandir.

Un environnement moderne (Mac, outils cloud, full remote + bureaux à Paris).

Un rôle clé pour la croissance interne : tu aideras 140 personnes à mieux bosser chaque jour.

Un poste évolutif : à terme, tu pourras monter en compétence vers l’automatisation et les sujets SRE/DevOps.

Conditions

CDI à temps plein – basé à Paris

Matériel Apple fourni

Accès à tous les outils internes

Formation et accompagnement assurés par l’équipe RH

Comment postuler

Envoie-nous un petit message (pas besoin d’une lettre formelle) où tu expliques : ce que tu aimes dans l’IT, pourquoi tu veux rejoindre une scale-up tech, et un exemple de situation où tu as résolu un problème technique avec ingéniosité.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
À propos de lemlist

lemlist est une Sales Engagement Platform utilisée par plus de 40 000 équipes commerciales dans le monde pour automatiser et personnaliser leurs campagnes de prospection.

On est une équipe de 140 personnes passionnées, en majorité en full remote, mais notre cœur bat toujours à Paris

Aujourd’hui, on grandit vite, et on a besoin de renforcer notre infrastructure interne pour que tout le monde puisse travailler dans les meilleures conditions possibles.

Ta mission

Tu seras le point de contact principal pour tout ce qui touche à l’IT interne

Tu feras en sorte que les outils de l’entreprise fonctionnent sans friction.

Tu aideras les nouveaux à s’installer rapidement et sans galère.

Tu automatiseras petit à petit les tâches répétitives et amélioreras la documentation.

Ton rôle est simple : rendre la vie plus fluide pour toutes les équipes (Sales, Support, Marketing, Tech…) en prenant en charge les sujets IT qui leur font perdre du temps.

Tes responsabilités principales

 - Support et gestion IT interne

 - Gérer les comptes Google Workspace (création, suppression, habilitations).

 - Aider les équipes sur les accès aux outils (Tailscale, Bravas, outils internes, etc.).

 - Maintenir les postes utilisateurs (Mac principalement) : mises à jour, sécurité, configuration.

 - Assurer la gestion du parc informatique avec notre MDM.

 - Gérer l’onboarding et l’offboarding IT des collaborateurs (matériel, accès, outils).

 - Rédiger et maintenir la documentation interne (Notion).

Sécurité et fiabilité

 - Veiller au respect des bonnes pratiques IT (2FA, gestion des accès, sécurité des postes).

 - Travailler avec l’équipe SRE sur l’automatisation de certains process (scripts, monitoring).

Amélioration continue

 - Identifier les irritants récurrents et proposer des solutions simples.

 - Automatiser progressivement les tâches répétitives

 - Participer à la réflexion sur les outils internes et les process IT.

Profil recherché

Tu es curieux, rigoureux, et tu adores résoudre des problèmes techniques.

Tu as déjà une première expérience (stage ou alternance) en support IT, helpdesk ou administration système.

Tu maîtrises l’environnement MacOS

Tu connais Google Workspace et idéalement des outils comme Tailscale, Slack.

Tu es à l’aise avec l’anglais écrit (nos outils et docs sont en anglais).

Tu es autonome, tu aimes apprendre et documenter ce que tu fais.

Bonus : tu touches un peu à la ligne de commande, au scripting ou tu veux apprendre le DevOps à moyen terme.

Pourquoi nous rejoindre

Une équipe tech exigeante mais bienveillante, qui t’aidera à grandir.

Un environnement moderne (Mac, outils cloud, full remote + bureaux à Paris).

Un rôle clé pour la croissance interne : tu aideras 140 personnes à mieux bosser chaque jour.

Un poste évolutif : à terme, tu pourras monter en compétence vers l’automatisation et les sujets SRE/DevOps.

Conditions

Matériel Apple fourni

Accès à tous les outils internes

Formation et accompagnement assurés par l’équipe RH

jobs.title: Senior Fullstack JavaScript Developer (Product Engineer)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🚀 About lempire

lempire is a global B2B SaaS business with the mission to help any business grow.
We are doing over $36M in ARR while being:

  • Bootstrapped

  • Profitable

  • A small, agile team of 100 highly talented people, remote-friendly

  • Majority owned by an entrepreneur, Guillaume Moubeche, Founder & Chairman — which gives us maximum freedom

We operate 2 business lines:

  1. Sales Engagement with our flagship product lemlist, generating $31M ARR and growing over 40% year over year

  2. Personal Branding with Taplio & Tweet Hunter, generating $5M ARR

lempire is a highly ambitious company that aims to become a world-class giant in the Sales Tech space.
Our mantra: Keep growing – and we live by it every day.

Job description

We're looking for a Senior Fullstack Javascript Developer to join our team. You'll be responsible for designing and developing new features for our SaaS products. We need someone who is passionate, autonomous, and loves technical challenges.

Your main missions will be:

  • Design and develop new features from scratch, both on the frontend and backend, Independently developing new features that enhance user experience and increase product functionality.

  • Stepping into the role of technical lead within your squad, driving excellence and setting standards.

  • Improve the code base with refactoring, bug fixes, and optimization

  • Work on multiple projects simultaneously

  • Help the customer support team on technical issues, providing prompt and effective solutions

  • Facilitating knowledge sharing and capacity building by training fellow developers, enhancing overall team competency and productivity.

Key results

  • Within 3 months you will have

  • Successfully onboarded and integrated into the team

  • Developed a deep understanding of our B2B SaaS products and their technical requirements

  • Contributed to the development of new features and improvements to our existing code base

  • Within 12 months you will have

  • Played a key role in the development and delivery of multiple successful projects

  • Made significant contributions to the optimization and scalability of our software products

  • What’s in it for you?

  • Work in a profitable, bootstrapped, and high-growth company that doesn’t rely on external funding to live.

  • You will have the opportunity to make a lasting impact on a suite of products that are changing the game in multiple industries.

  • Work with passionate senior engineers who share their knowledge and expertise

  • Great ownership of your work. You will be part of a dynamic, innovative, and passionate team that respects autonomy and encourages individual input.

  • No endless meetings

  • Full remote policy

  • You will grow professionally and personally, enhancing your technical skills and expanding your global network.

Preferred experience

  • Must have

  • You’re an expert in Javascript with at least 5 years of XP

  • You have a proven track record in building and maintaining web applications.

  • You have a robust understanding of NodeJS and MongoDB

  • You’re able to work independently and take ownership of complex projects

  • You’re a fast learner

  • You’re comfortable with the agile methodologies

  • You like to communicate

  • You like to work remotely, Gather, Slack and Notion are your best friends

  • You are adaptable and like to discover new things and you can work on front-end integration, back-end development, mongo optimization, customer support, and more

  • You speak French and English and you are in the French timezone

  • Nice to have

  • You have a first experience in B2B SaaS startup

  • You are self-taught, you have been developing personal projects since you were a child or in the evenings and weekends. This is not mandatory but a big plus for us, we are all passionate about programming and like to create things, both at work and outside

Additional Information

  • Salary between 55K€ and 65K€ fixed salary + 15K€ bonus

  • Where you live, and work is totally up to you – we do have an office in Paris if you enjoy life at the office 🇫🇷

  • Profit sharing: When lempire wins, all team members share the profits

  • Alan Blue: Comprehensive 100% premium medical coverage for you and your family

  • Swile Meal Tickets: Enjoy daily meal tickets to fuel productivity

  • Navigo Card: Seamless commuting with a 100% covered Navigo card

  •  Full-remote Work Setup: A well-funded home office budget to ensure seamless remote work

  • Gear: Get a Macbook Pro + tools and equipment you need for your job

  • Team building: We all meet once per year at really cool places around the world (you can check our video here ;)

Recruitment process

  • Interview with Lucas our TAM

  • Interview with Mickael, our CTO

  • Technical Interview with Mickael, our CTO, and Corentin, our VP of Engineering

  • Interview with Charles, our CEO

jobs.title: Tech Lead - Fullstack JS/TS
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About lemlist

lemlist is a global B2B SaaS business with one mission: help any business grow.

We’re doing $38M+ ARR, while being:

  • Bootstrapped & profitable

  • 120 people, remote-friendly, agile

  • Majority-owned by our founder Guillaume Moubeche, giving us freedom and independence

We run two product lines:

  • Sales Engagement with lemlist ($33M ARR, growing +45% YoY)

  • Social selling with Taplio & Tweet Hunter ($5M ARR)

Our ambition: become a world-class giant in Sales Tech.

Our mantra: Keep growing.

About the role

We’re looking for a Tech Lead or a Senior Fullstack JavaScript Developer to join our team.

👉 The role starts as a Senior Developer, then evolves into a Tech Lead position after 3-6 months, once you’ve proven yourself in the squad.

You’ll design, build, and ship features across frontend and backend, improve performance, and progressively take leadership within your squad to set technical standards, mentor peers, and drive delivery.

What you’ll do

  • Build new features end-to-end (frontend + backend) by working hand-in-hand with a strong Product team

  • Improve the codebase (refactoring, bug fixes, optimization)

  • Collaborate with the rest of the team to solve technical issues

  • Mentor fellow developers, share knowledge, and raise the bar

  • Step up as Tech Lead in your squad: drive quality, make technical choices, and align delivery

What success looks like

Within 3 months

  • You’re fully onboarded and comfortable in our stack

  • You’ve shipped meaningful features in production

  • You’ve contributed to improving our codebase

Within 6 months

  • You’ve led delivery of multiple successful projects

  • You’ve had direct impact on scalability & performance

  • You’ve grown into your Tech Lead role and mentor others

What’s in it for you

  • Join a bootstrapped, profitable, fast-growing SaaS company

  • Build products used by thousands of businesses worldwide

  • See your impact quickly with a very short feedback loop

  • Work with senior engineers who love to learn and share knowledge

  • Remote-first culture (office in Paris if you prefer 🇫🇷)

  • No endless meetings, high autonomy, big impact

About you

Must have

  • 7+ years in JavaScript (frontend + backend)

  • Solid skills in Node.js, React, MongoDB

  • Proven track record building & maintaining web apps

  • Always hungry to learn more, particularly around JS/TS

  • Autonomous, fast learner, and collaborative

  • Fluent in French & English, based in French timezone (+/- 2h)

Nice to have

  • B2B SaaS startup experience

  • You already worked on Meteorjs or on real-time apps

  • Self-taught hacker or side-project builder

  • Passionate about experimenting & creating beyond work

Package

  • Starting as Senior: 65-70K€ fixed + 15K€ bonus

  • Moving to Tech Lead: 75K€ fixed + 15K€ bonus

  • Profit sharing: when lemlist wins, you win too

  • Full perks: Alan Blue (healthcare) 100% taken care of for you and your family, Swile meal vouchers, 100% of your Navigo card, MacBook Pro & remote setup budget

  • Annual global team retreat in amazing locations 🌍

Recruitment process

  1. Interview with Lucas (TAM)

  2. Interview with Mickael (CTO)

  3. Technical interview with Mickael (CTO) & Corentin (VP Engineering)

  4. Final chat with Charles (CEO)

jobs.title: Office Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us 👇🏼

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.
Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from 0 to $35M ARR in 6 years, without raising a single dollar.
Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.

Mission

Are you a pro at getting things done and deliver “wow”?

At lemlist, we believe in the power of organization and efficiency to drive success!

As a Workplace and Event Manager, you will be the backbone of our office, providing essential support to our team and contributing to a positive and productive work environment! 🚀✨

Your main missions will be:

Office - Manage our lemlist HQ in Paris (75002)

  • Be the main point of contact at the office & manage any office issues with our space managers (cleaning teams, wifi etc.)

  • Manage badge registration & worldwide access to coworking spaces for our remote workers

  • Handle snacks, beverages & office supplies, always making sure were never missing anything

  • Work hand-in-hand with our design team to create lemlist’ goodies for employees and events

  • Keep a clean inventory of all supplies & goodies

  • Oversee contracts in link with office management

  • Continuously improve our office space to provide the best experience for our team members

lemflat & lemhouse - Manage our two unique places

  • lemflat (4 bedroom apartment in Paris)

  • lemhouse (800m2 house near Avignon)

    • Manage the lemhouse from a distance with our house manager

  • Manage a budget of 500k€ per year

  • Plan and coordinate Team retreats at the lemhouse

If you read our Culture Manifesto and thought "that's totally me!" then this job is perfect for you.

If you're organized, detail-oriented, and ready to roll up your sleeves, join lemlist and help us elevate our employee experience! ⭐

What's in it for you?

  • Central role in a fast-paced, growing startup environment

  • Responsibility for managing substantial team building, office, and retreat budgets

Must have

Nice to have

  3. Last round / Culture fit with Charles (CEO) (30 min)

  4. Ref check

→ You’re in 🙌!

jobs.title: Staff Engineer - Fullstack JS/TS
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About lemlist

lemlist is a global B2B SaaS business with one mission: help any business grow.

We’re doing $38M+ ARR, while being:

  • Bootstrapped & profitable

  • 120 people, remote-friendly, agile

  • Majority-owned by our founder Guillaume Moubeche, giving us freedom and independence

We run two product lines:

  • Sales Engagement with lemlist ($33M ARR, growing +45% YoY)

  • Social selling with Taplio & Tweet Hunter ($5M ARR)

Our ambition: become a world-class giant in Sales Tech.

Our mantra: Keep growing.

About the role

We’re looking for a Staff Engineer to join our team.

You’ll design, build, and ship features across frontend and backend, improve performance, and progressively take leadership on more transversal topics, mentor peers, and drive delivery.

What you’ll do

  • Build new features end-to-end (frontend + backend) by working hand-in-hand with a strong Product team

  • Improve the codebase (refactoring, bug fixes, optimization)

  • Collaborate with the rest of the team to solve technical issues

  • Mentor fellow developers, share knowledge, and raise the bar

  • Step up as Tech Lead on specific topics: drive quality, make technical choices, and align delivery

What success looks like

Within 3 months

  • You’re fully onboarded and comfortable in our stack

  • You’ve shipped meaningful features in production

  • You’ve contributed to improving our codebase

Within 12 months

  • You’ve led delivery of multiple successful projects

  • You’ve had direct impact on scalability & performance

  • You’ve grown into your an internal reference on some technical topics and mentor others

What’s in it for you

  • Join a bootstrapped, profitable, fast-growing SaaS company

  • Build products used by thousands of businesses worldwide

  • See your impact quickly with a very short feedback loop

  • Work with senior engineers who love to learn and share knowledge

  • Remote-first culture (office in Paris if you prefer 🇫🇷)

  • No endless meetings, high autonomy, big impact

About you

Must have

  • 7+ years in JavaScript (frontend + backend)

  • Solid skills in Node.js, React, MongoDB

  • Proven track record building & maintaining web apps

  • Always hungry to learn more, particularly around JS/TS

  • Autonomous, fast learner, and collaborative

  • Fluent in French & English, based in French timezone (+/- 2h)

Nice to have

  • B2B SaaS startup experience

  • You already worked on Meteorjs or on real-time apps

  • Self-taught hacker or side-project builder

  • Passionate about experimenting & creating beyond work

Package

  • 70-75K€ fixed + 15K€ bonus

  • Profit sharing: when lemlist wins, you win too

  • Full perks: Alan Blue (healthcare) 100% taken care of for you and your family, Swile meal vouchers, 100% of your Navigo card, MacBook Pro & remote setup budget

  • Annual global team retreat in amazing locations 🌍

Recruitment process

  1. Interview with Lucas (TAM)

  2. Interview with Mickael (CTO)

  3. Technical interview with Mickael (CTO) & Corentin (VP Engineering)

  4. Final chat with Charles (CEO)

jobs.title: Top talent wanted
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At lemlist, we don’t care about your fancy degrees, shiny company names and job titles.

We care about who you are, what you can bring, and how far you’re willing to go.

We believe greatness often hides in the outcasts, the underdogs, the grinders who don’t always tick the “traditional boxes”…

But people who show up, show heart, and break ceilings.

That is why we are launching the lemstar program – a talent rocket ship designed to find and elevate future stars who will shape the future of lemlist.

If you’re in the top 1% of potential, creativity, and hustle, this is your launchpad. 🚀

This is not a usual job application.

We want you to pitch us a moonshot project, something bold, original, and wildly ambitious that could 10x lemlist (or create a new revenue stream entirely).

How to apply?

  1. Think of a moonshot idea for lemlist (e.g. product, growth hack, feature, marketing campaign, new vertical, mini-tool, podcasts - whatever gets you fired up)

  2. Build a prototype, asset, or MVP, it could be a landing page, a scrappy demo or Figma, a Notion doc, anything tangible and real.

  3. Record a 5-minute elevator pitch video explaining:

    • The idea

    • The why

    • The impact

    • Your process

    • What’s next

No resumes. No fluff. Just raw creative fire.

Who are we looking for?

At lemlist, we believe the best people don't always fit into neat job titles or polished LinkedIn profiles.

We want builders, doers, the misfits, the relentless doers who turn wild ideas into real things.

  • You are young and talented — you have less than 2–3 years of experience

  • You're scrappy, resourceful, and not afraid to roll up your sleeves.

  • You've got that extra-mile mindset and are willing to show your impact since Day 1.

  • You spot opportunities where others see limits - even ones we haven't thought of yet.

  • You don't wait for permission or find excuses. You pitch, you build, you launch.

  • You're hungry to learn, resilient in the face of failure, and bounce back stronger.

  • You bring energy, originality, and heart into everything you do.

You can apply for any role across Marketing, Product, Tech, Sales, or Operations.

If you've ever been told "You don't have enough experience or the right academics," this program was made for you.

What you get from it?

  • Work with an A-players team and learn directly from top leaders who’ve scaled global startups.

  • Competitive salary package and benefits (above market)

  • Fast-track program with a steep learning curve and fast-moving environment.

  • Real ownership from Day 1 - no babysitting, no micromanagement.

Interview process

  • Let's see your moonshot first

jobs.title: AI Productivity Engineer (95% Dev/ 5% DevOps)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Et si ton prochain job n’était pas de coder, mais de manager des IA qui codent à ta place ?

C’est pas un délire futuriste. C’est déjà ce que certains vivent : ils orchestrent Claude, Gemini, Cursor comme une équipe fantôme.

Ils designent avec Figma Make, lancent un prompt structuré, valident, refactorent.
Ils codent encore… mais comme un chef d’orchestre joue du violon : pour guider, pas pour tout faire eux-mêmes.

Chez lemlist, on ne regarde pas cette révolution IA de loin.
On l’intègre à fond : dans nos produits mais aussi dans nos process internes.

Mission :
On veut aller plus loin, et si tu nous rejoins, tu seras responsable de la veille, de l’expérimentation et de l’intégration des outils IA qui peuvent améliorer le quotidien des développeurs. Ton objectif est d’augmenter la productivité des équipes tech, sans sacrifier la qualité ni la maintenabilité du code. Tu seras aussi un moteur de la conduite du changement autour de ces outils.

Responsabilités :

  • Tester et benchmarker les outils IA de génération de code (Claude, Cursor, KiloCode, etc.)

  • Coder des POC, scripts et intégrations internes pour tester puis industrialiser les pratiques IA

  • Proposer des intégrations concrètes dans notre stack (MeteorJS, monorepo, CI/CD)

  • Former les devs et documenter les meilleures pratiques

  • Mesurer l’impact, au moins de manière grossière (délais de livraison, fréquence de déploiement, qualité de code)

  • Développer des features de la roadmap lemlist pour appliquer tes propres workflows IA et démontrer par la pratique que ça fonctionne

  • Assurer le lien avec les PM et vérifier avec eux que la qualité est au rendez-vous

  • Trouver des leviers pour aller plus loin dans l'intégration des processes produit AI-based

Profil recherché :

  • Grande expérience en terme de développement et industrialisation du code

  • 5 ans minimum d’expérience en développement web (JS/TS, Node, React)

  • Au moins une expérience d’outillage IA dans une équipe > 5 devs, avec preuves d’impact mesuré

  • Bonne culture DevOps

  • Expérience avec des outils IA ou APIs LLM (OpenAI, Claude, etc.)

  • Esprit structuré, autonome, capable de documenter, vulgariser et évangéliser

  • Forte curiosité, capable de creuser en profondeur un sujet technique

  • Expérience en conduite du changement ou en formation interne

Réalisations attendues après 3 mois

  • Audit complet de la chaîne CI/CD et du monorepo : points de friction, coût tokens, métriques DORA de référence.

  • Deux POC IA opérationnels (ex. Kilo Code + review assistée) mesurant vitesse et qualité sur des features réelles.

  • Première intégration outillage IA dans la pipeline (tests auto ou changelog généré).

  • Guidelines v1 + mini-formations : ≥ 30 % des devs utilisent activement au moins un nouveau workflow IA.

Réalisations attendues après 12 mois

  • Outils IA industrialisés et maintenus (CI/CD, review, monitoring) sur l’ensemble du monorepo.

  • Adoption 100 % des devs, avec cycles de formation interne et playbooks à jour.

  • Lead-time code→prod réduit, taux de rollback en baisse.

  • Budget IA optimisé : suivi coûts/tokens + politiques de quotas, etc.

  • Trois nouveaux workflows IA déployés (génération de tests, refactor assisté, détection automatique de dettes techniques).

  • Audit trimestriel qualité + sécurité validé, documentation prête pour un éventuel audit externe.

jobs.title: Fullstack Developer – Taplio & TweetHunter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us 👇🏼

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.
Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from 0 to $35M ARR in 6 years, without raising a single dollar.
Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.


💻 The Role

We’re looking for a Fullstack Developer to fix, clean, and improve Taplio & Tweet Hunter.

If you want a brand-new project, this isn’t for you.

If you love building new things, but also turning messy code into something scalable and maintainable, keep reading.

🛠 What You’ll Do

• Refactor and optimize our codebase (Fullstack TypeScrip, Next.js, Google Cloud Platform).

• Identify and fix bugs across frontend and backend.

• Build amazing new features for our users

• Improve performance and maintainability.

• Support customer success, solving technical issues when needed.

• Challenge product requests, balancing speed and quality.


🔥 What’s in It for You?

✅ Fully remote & flexible work. Amazing offices in Paris.

✅ Join a profitable, bootstrapped, and high-growth company.

✅ Work with a motivated, no-BS team.

✅ Direct impact – your work will shape our product.


💡 Who You Are

✅ Must-Haves

3+ years experience

Strong JavaScript / TypeScript skills.

Proven experience cleaning messy code.

Responsible for your own code

Ability to see the big picture and suggest smart trade-offs.

Fast learner, proactive, and independent.

Fluent in English.

✨ Nice-to-Have

• Experience with Twitter Enterprise APIs.

• Experience with LinkedIn APIs.

• Strong GCP knowledge.


Additional Information

Salary up to 65K€ based on xp + 15K€ bonus

Where you live, and work is totally up to you – we do have an office in Paris if you enjoy life at the office 🇫🇷

Profit sharing: When lempire wins, all team members share the profits

Interview process

Interview with Victoire, our TAM

Fit dev+PM

Technical test

Interview with our GM
jobs.descriptionPlain:
About us 👇🏼

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.
Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from 0 to $35M ARR in 6 years, without raising a single dollar.
Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.




💻 The Role

We’re looking for a Fullstack Developer to fix, clean, and improve Taplio & Tweet Hunter.

If you want a brand-new project, this isn’t for you.

If you love building new things, but also turning messy code into something scalable and maintainable, keep reading.

🛠 What You’ll Do

• Refactor and optimize our codebase (Fullstack TypeScrip, Next.js, Google Cloud Platform).

• Identify and fix bugs across frontend and backend.

• Build amazing new features for our users

• Improve performance and maintainability.

• Support customer success, solving technical issues when needed.

• Challenge product requests, balancing speed and quality.




🔥 What’s in It for You?

✅ Fully remote & flexible work. Amazing offices in Paris.

✅ Join a profitable, bootstrapped, and high-growth company.

✅ Work with a motivated, no-BS team.

✅ Direct impact – your work will shape our product.




💡 Who You Are

✅ Must-Haves

3+ years experience

Strong JavaScript / TypeScript skills.

Proven experience cleaning messy code.

Responsible for your own code

Ability to see the big picture and suggest smart trade-offs.

Fast learner, proactive, and independent.

Fluent in English.

✨ Nice-to-Have

• Experience with Twitter Enterprise APIs.

• Experience with LinkedIn APIs.

• Strong GCP knowledge.




Additional Information

Salary up to 65K€ based on xp + 15K€ bonus

Where you live, and work is totally up to you – we do have an office in Paris if you enjoy life at the office 🇫🇷

Profit sharing: When lempire wins, all team members share the profits

Interview process

Interview with Victoire, our TAM

Fit dev+PM

Technical test

Interview with our GM

jobs.title: Customer Experience Representative  EN
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us 👇🏼

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.

Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from 0 to $35M ARR in 6 years, without raising a single dollar.

Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.

The role: Customer Experience Representative

We're looking for someone who’s curious, empathetic, and solution-driven to join our Customer Experience team. In this role, you’ll help users across our product suite succeed — guiding them, resolving their issues, and helping them see the value of our tools from day one.

You’ll work closely with Tech support, product, marketing and sales teams, using feedback from real users to make our tools and experiences better every day.

What you’ll do

  • Support and guide users of lemlist, lemwarm, and lemcal throughout their entire journey — from onboarding to advanced feature adoption.

  • Act as the primary point of contact for all user inquiries, whether related to features, setup, or technical issues — primarily through live chat, email, and occasional calls,

  • Identify recurring user pain points and proactively escalate them to the Product, Tech, and Marketing teams to help improve the overall user experience,

  • Work proactively to drive user retention, ensuring customers achieve their goals and get long-term value from the platform,

  • Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction with every interaction, always with a focus on retention and user success

Your first year at lemlist

Months 1–3: Learn and ramp-up

  • Follow a structured onboarding plan to get familiar with our product, tools, and processes,

  • Receive support and guidance from your team mentor,

  • Gradually start handling your first user tickets with supervision,

  • Main objective: Gain confidence and master the product and support processes.

Months 3–6: Grow and take ownership

  • Take on more complex and technical user requests,

  • Start leading conversations with users via video or phone when needed,

  • Deepen your understanding of customer needs and edge cases,

  • Main objective: Become fully autonomous in ticket handling and user communication.

Months 6–12: Contribute and have impact

  • Lead a side project based on your strengths and interests (e.g. FAQ improvements, process automation),

  • Proactively track and contribute to your impact: CSAT, activation and churn reduction,

  • Share valuable product feedback based on user insights and suggest improvements,

  • Main objective: Become a key voice in the team — both for users and internally.

Who are you?

  • You love building strong relationships with users and understanding their needs,

  • You can communicate complex ideas simply, both in writing and on calls.

  • You’re comfortable managing multiple conversations while maintaining a high standard of support,

  • You’re curious, proactive, and eager to learn in a fast-paced environment,

  • You’re fluent in both English and another European language, written and spoken.

What’s in it for you ?

  • Competitive salary + company bonus (up to 15K€ per year depending on company's performance)

  • 37 days of holidays/year

  • Alan Blue: Comprehensive 100% premium medical coverage for you and your family

  • Swile Meal Tickets: Enjoy daily meal tickets to fuel productivity

  • Navigo Card: Seamless commuting with a 100% covered Navigo card

  • Gear: Get the laptop tools and equipment you need for your job

  • Team building: We all meet once per year at really cool places around the world (you can check our video here ;)

Recruitment Process

  • Interview with Victoire our Talent Acquisition Manager

  • Business Case (async.) + Live Q&A with Ena our Head of Customer Experience

  • Interview with Guillaume, our VP Customer Experience

  • Interview with Charles, our CEO or Oriane Chief of Staff

  • Reference Check

  • Offer

jobs.title: Affiliates & Influence Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us 👇🏼

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.

Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from 0 to $35M ARR in 6 years, without raising a single dollar.

Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.

We’re looking for an Affiliates & Influence Manager to take full ownership of our Influencer and Affiliate acquisition channels—helping us expand our reach, strengthen our brand, and generate scalable revenue.

Both channels are already proven revenue drivers for lemlist:

  • Our affiliate community counts 1,400+ active members, already generating 10% of new revenue.

  • Our influence marketing efforts (mainly on LinkedIn) are driving strong traction and results. We’re already working with Sales Influencers like Noam and Haris?

Now, we’re ready to double down and scale these channels to the next level. This is a high-impact role inside our Growth team, working directly with the Head of Growth. You’ll be in the driver’s seat to grow, structure, and scale both programs into major acquisition levers for lemlist.

What you’ll do

  • Influence → Source and manage influencers (LinkedIn, YouTube, and beyond), launch collabs, and scale the channel to 4x revenue in the next 12 months.

  • Affiliates → Animate, engage, and grow our affiliate community (1,400+ members), build toolkits and campaigns that drive measurable results, and scale revenue contribution.

  • Be the go-to partner for influencers and affiliates: provide the right assets, support, and strategy to help them—and lemlist—win.

  • Work closely with the Growth team to ensure affiliates and influencers become a repeatable and scalable acquisition machine.

Your first year at lemlist

Months 1–3: Learn and ramp-up

  • Take full ownership of influence marketing operations and double activations on LinkedIn.

  • Build a process to manage affiliates more efficiently and provide them with content kits and support.

  • Main objective: Deliver early revenue impact (+10% from affiliates) and set strong foundations.

Months 3–6: Grow and take ownership

  • Expand influencer collaborations and start testing on new platforms (YouTube, Instagram).

  • Strengthen affiliate community engagement with regular campaigns and activation challenges.

  • Main objective: Drive consistency, increase performance, and prepare for scale.

Months 6–12: Contribute and have impact

  • Scale the influence channel across new platforms to deliver 4x revenue vs. today.

  • Build a thriving, self-sufficient affiliate community that consistently drives 2x revenue.

  • Main objective: Make Affiliates & Influence one of lemlist’s top-performing growth channels.

Who you are

  • Growth-minded → You’ve already done it: managed influencers, affiliates, or both, ideally at scale.

  • Content-aware → You know the codes of LinkedIn, YouTube, TikTok, and how to turn influence into an acquisition channel.

  • Sales Knowledge → You have knowledge of (or at least a strong interest in) the sales profession, especially when it comes to creating content that resonates with salespeople.

  • Community-driven → You thrive at engaging networks, building relationships, and creating momentum in partner communities.

  • Hands-on & organized → You can both design strategy and execute campaigns while keeping operations clean.

  • International → You speak excellent English and have strong international culture.

  • Experienced → You bring 3+ years in affiliate, partnerships, or influence management, ideally with a proven track record of scaling these channels.

What’s in it for you ?

  • Competitive salary + company bonus (up to 15K€ per year depending on company’s performance)

  • 37 days of holidays/year (+3 days offered by lempire)

  • Alan Blue: Comprehensive 100% premium medical coverage for you and your family

  • Swile Meal Tickets: Enjoy daily meal tickets to fuel productivity

  • Navigo Card: Seamless commuting with a 100% covered Navigo card

  • Gear: Get the laptop, tools, and equipment you need for your job

  • Team building: We all meet once per year at really cool places around the world (check our video here)

Recruitment Process

  1. Interview with Victoire, our Talent Acquisition Manager

  2. Interview with Erwan, Head of Growth

  3. Business Case (async.) + Live Q&A with Erwan (Head of Growth) & Domitille (CMO)

  4. Interview with Charles, our CEO

  5. Culture Fit with Marketing team Members

  6. Reference Check

  7. Offer

jobs.title: Senior RevOps
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us 👇🏼

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.

Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from 0 to $35M ARR in 6 years, without raising a single dollar.

Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.

Mission

At lemlist, execution beats talk.

We are looking for a Revenue Operations Manager to help our customer-facing teams perform at their best as we scale from 40M$ to 100M$+ ARR, bootstrapped & profitable.

Your mission is to understand how revenue teams operate, identify friction, and design scalable processes, tools, and insights that drive growth and efficiency across the company.

You will work within a small and agile RevOps team and stay generalist across Sales, Key Accounts, Support, and Partnerships.

Your responsibilities

You will work on projects that have a direct impact on how the business runs. Your scope will evolve based on your skills, interests, and company priorities.

1/ Sales Operations and Performance

  • Manage lead routing and buyer experience to ensure prospects reach the right sales person fast and with quality.

  • Improve HubSpot setup, structure, and reporting to boost productivity and data reliability.

  • Compute sales commissions, model changes, and ensure clarity and fairness across teams.

  • Optimize quote-to-cash flows across Hyperline, Stripe, and HubSpot with Sales and Product teams.

  • Track conversion, productivity, and pipeline velocity at both team and individual level.

2/ Customer Experience Operations and AI Knowledge

  • Manage Intercom workflows, automation, and reporting to improve customer journey.

  • Work with VP CX and Head of Support to make support faster and better.

  • Collaborate with Product and Knowledge teams to build AI tools that make everyone more efficient.

  • Prepare and support potential tool migrations such as Intercom to Zendesk.

3/ Key Accounts

  • Help structure and scale the Key Account Management team.

  • Build processes and tools to help CSMs prioritize, track, and grow accounts.

  • Create reporting and playbooks to ensure consistency and results.

4/ Partnerships, Channels, and Affiliation

  • Streamline affiliate operations including PartnerStack integration, fraud control, and HubSpot syncing.

  • Build solid foundations for partnership and channel sales motions with VP Sales and Lead Growth.

  • Support revenue attribution and performance tracking across all motions.

5/ M&A Integration

  • Lead tool and CRM migrations after acquisitions.

  • Align processes, data, and systems across entities to create one unified GTM engine.

If you read our Culture Manifesto and thought "this is 100% me", you will thrive in this role.

What’s in it for you

  • Join a fast-growing SaaS company scaling from 40M to 100M ARR.

  • Work on high-impact projects that touch every part of the revenue engine.

  • Get full ownership and autonomy from day one.

  • Collaborate directly with the C-suite on strategic topics.

  • Learn how to scale revenue systems in a PLG + SLG environment.

  • Work with a team obsessed with speed, growth, and impact.

Preferred experience

Must have

  • 3 to 7 years of experience in RevOps or related roles such as Sales Ops, BizOps, or GTM Ops.

  • Experience in high-velocity SaaS, ideally PLG + SLG.

  • Good knowledge of HubSpot (setup, automation, reporting).

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset.

  • High ownership, structure, and execution speed.

  • Fluent in English.

Nice to have

  • Experience with Intercom, Stripe, Hyperline, or PartnerStack.

  • Experience with M&A integrations or tool migrations.

  • Knowledge of SQL, data analytics, or automation tools like n8n or Make.

Recruitment process

  1. Screening call with Victoire, Talent Acquisition Manager (30 min)

  2. Interview with Charles, CEO (45 min)

  3. Business case

  4. Business case debrief with Head of Finance and former Lead RevOps

  5. Reference check

You’re in 🙌

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.

Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from 0 to $35M ARR in 6 years, without raising a single dollar.

Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.


THE ROLE: CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE REPRESENTATIVE

We're looking for someone who’s curious, empathetic, and solution-driven to join our Customer Experience team. In this role, you’ll help users across our product suite succeed — guiding them, resolving their issues, and helping them see the value of our tools from day one.

You’ll work closely with Tech support, product, marketing and sales teams, using feedback from real users to make our tools and experiences better every day.


WHAT YOU’LL DO

 - Support and guide users of lemlist, lemwarm, and lemcal throughout their entire journey — from onboarding to advanced feature adoption.

 - Act as the primary point of contact for all user inquiries, whether related to features, setup, or technical issues — primarily through live chat, email, and occasional calls,

 - Identify recurring user pain points and proactively escalate them to the Product, Tech, and Marketing teams to help improve the overall user experience,

 - Work proactively to drive user retention, ensuring customers achieve their goals and get long-term value from the platform,

 - Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction with every interaction, always with a focus on retention and user success


YOUR FIRST YEAR AT LEMLIST


MONTHS 1–3: LEARN AND RAMP-UP

 - Follow a structured onboarding plan to get familiar with our product, tools, and processes,

 - Receive support and guidance from your team mentor,

 - Gradually start handling your first user tickets with supervision,

 - Main objective: Gain confidence and master the product and support processes.


MONTHS 3–6: GROW AND TAKE OWNERSHIP

 - Take on more complex and technical user requests,

 - Start leading conversations with users via video or phone when needed,

 - Deepen your understanding of customer needs and edge cases,

 - Main objective: Become fully autonomous in ticket handling and user communication.


MONTHS 6–12: CONTRIBUTE AND HAVE IMPACT

 - Lead a side project based on your strengths and interests (e.g. FAQ improvements, process automation),

 - Proactively track and contribute to your impact: CSAT, activation and churn reduction,

 - Share valuable product feedback based on user insights and suggest improvements,

 - Main objective: Become a key voice in the team — both for users and internally.


WHO ARE YOU?

 - You love building strong relationships with users and understanding their needs,

 - You can communicate complex ideas simply, both in writing and on calls.

 - You’re comfortable managing multiple conversations while maintaining a high standard of support,

 - You’re curious, proactive, and eager to learn in a fast-paced environment,

 - You’re fluent in both English and French, written and spoken.


WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU ?

 - Competitive salary + company bonus (up to 15K€ per year depending on company's performance)

 - 37 days of holidays/year (25 +RTT+3 days offered by lemlist)

 - Alan Blue: Comprehensive 100% premium medical coverage for you and your family

 - Swile Meal Tickets: Enjoy daily meal tickets to fuel productivity

 - Navigo Card: Seamless commuting with a 100% covered Navigo card

 - Gear: Get the laptop tools and equipment you need for your job

 - Team building: We all meet once per year at really cool places around the world (you can check our video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nwUEuQXa4Jw here ;)


RECRUITMENT PROCESS

 - Interview with Victoire our Talent Acquisition Manager

 - Interview with Guillaume, our VP Customer Experience

 - Business Case (async.) + Live Q&A with Ena our Head of Customer Experience

 - Interview with Charles, our CEO

 - Reference Check

 - Offer

jobs.title: Head of lemlist Coaching Program
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us 👇🏼

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.

Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from $0 to $35M ARR in 6 years — without raising a single dollar.

Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.

We’re now looking for a Head of Coaching Program to build and scale our Lemcoach initiative — a new strategic lever to reduce churn and strengthen retention at scale.

Lemcoach is a 1:1 coaching program designed to help our customers master outbound fundamentals: better deliverability, sharper messaging, and higher reply rates. After a successful pilot, we’re now ready to scale it.

This is a high-impact role inside the Growth team. Growth will own the distribution and sales of the coaching program, and your mission will be to own everything that happens after the deal is signed: operations, delivery, quality, and results. Freelancers are already ready to work — your job is to turn this into a smooth, scalable machine.

What you’ll do

  • Own the Lemcoach program end-to-end after signing → build the operational backbone that allows us to deliver thousands of coachings in 2026.

  • Manage a pool of 10+ freelancers (already sourced) → onboard, schedule, and ensure consistent delivery at scale.

  • Ensure delivery quality → standardize the playbook, define SLAs, monitor satisfaction and impact on performance.

  • Coordinate with Growth, CS, and Product to align coaching delivery with revenue and churn goals.

  • Track KPIs (coaching volume, satisfaction, retention uplift, churn impact) and continuously optimize processes.

  • Build repeatable systems to make Lemcoach a scalable retention engine.

Your first year at lemlist

Months 1–3: Learn & structure

  • Take ownership of all Lemcoach operations.

  • Build internal processes, coach onboarding, quality checks, and reporting.

  • Deliver ~100 coachings/month with the existing freelancer pool.

    👉 Objective: deliver early operational impact and build a clean foundation.

Months 3–6: Optimize & scale

  • Scale the freelancer pool activity to support ~150 coachings/month.

  • Implement SLAs and reporting to make delivery predictable and measurable.

  • Strengthen alignment with Growth and CS teams.

    👉 Objective: build a stable, scalable delivery machine.

Months 6–12: Scale & impact

  • Scale to 250–300 coachings/month with high quality and predictable outcomes.

  • Optimize freelancer performance and playbook.

  • Contribute directly to measurable churn reduction.

    👉 Objective: turn Lemcoach into a strategic retention lever.

Who you are

  • You’re an outbound expert — you live and breathe outbound strategies, sequences, deliverability, and performance.

  • You’ve built or scaled your own agency or outbound operation, and you know exactly what it takes to turn a few processes into a real machine.

  • You think in systems, not tasks — playbooks, SOPs, and scalable delivery are second nature to you.

  • You know how to lead freelancers and operators, keep quality high, and move fast without losing control.

  • You thrive in fast-moving environments where nothing is fully built yet — and you love being the one to build it.

  • You’re not here to just follow a process — you’re here to design and scale it.

  • You don’t need to coach clients yourself, but you know what great outbound looks like and can make sure it’s delivered consistently.

What’s in it for you

  • Competitive salary + company bonus (up to 15K€ per year depending on company performance)

  • 37 days of holidays/year (+3 days offered by lempire)

  • Alan Blue: Comprehensive 100% premium medical coverage for you and your family

  • Swile Meal Tickets

  • Navigo Card fully covered

  • All the gear and tools you need

  • Yearly team offsite in an amazing destination

Recruitment Process

  • Interview with Erwan, Head of Growth

  • Business Case (async.) + Live Q&A with Erwan (Head of Growth) & Domitille (CMO)

  • Interview with Charles, our CEO

  • Culture fit with Marketing team members

  • Reference check

  • Offer 🎉

jobs.title: Head of Product Design
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us 👇🏼

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.
Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from 0 to $35M ARR in 6 years, without raising a single dollar.
Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.

As Head of Design at lemlist, you’ll lead and scale our design team across product, and user experience.

You’ll work closely with our Designers, PMs, and Engineerings to shape how our products look, feel, work and most importantly solve real problems for our users.

This role is about user impact, not just pixels: you’ll set the vision for design, empower your team, and raise the bar for creativity & execution.

You will:

  • Develop a deep understanding of our market, industry, users, company, and product vision

  • Dig beneath the surface to uncover real problems and opportunities

  • Define and articulate a bold design vision that aligns with lemlist’s mission and product strategy

  • Establish design principles, processes, and systems that drive consistency, speed, and quality across squads

  • Challenge and drive each Product Designer to raise the bar and reach higher impact

  • Be hands-on by owning the entire delivery process with Product Managers

  • Push the boundaries of what “great design” means in the Sales tech space, especially as AI is changing how Sales teams work

  • Create world-class design experiences that position lemlist as the leading software in our space

  • Shape what the future of Product Design looks like (including AI)

We’re not looking for designers who:

  • Only remains in a management position

  • Only sees design by the book

  • Tries to reinvent the wheel everywhere

  • Wait for instructions instead of being proactive

  • Are uncomfortable speaking with users or digging into real value creation

  • Don’t make user impact their priority

  • Enjoy their comfort zone

  • Spend more time in processes and complexe methodologies than bringing value to users

What’s in it for you:

  • Drive innovation in the Sales tech space

  • Define and scale the product design culture at one of the fastest growing Sales tech Saas

  • Challenge the statut quo of the industry

  • A lot of autonomy on how your squad should thrive to be successful

  • A place where best ideas win

  • A remote friendly environment

  • A chance to work with an innovative, fast-paced team with a bias for action

Key results

Within 3 months you will have:

  • Gained a deep understanding of our product, industry, and vision

  • Built relationships with lemlist users, and have a deep understanding of them

  • Owned the entire delivery process from end to end

  • Successfully created value for users

  • Identified problems and defined how product design should evolve at lemlist

Within 12 months you will have:

  • Launched solutions that positively impact users and the company’s revenue

  • Established yourself as an industry expert with deep insight into our customers

  • Influenced and improved the roadmap

  • Helped shape the future of lemlist and Sales prospection

  • Established a design culture where excellence, speed, and user-centricity are the norm

  • Raised the bar and supported Product Designers to deliver more impact

Preferred experience

Must have

  • You have 7+ years of experience in Product Design, with at least 3+ years in a leadership position. Scale-up experience is preferred.

  • Proven experience elevating design quality and growing the impact of design teams in SaaS environments

  • Strong portfolio showing excellence in product design and design leadership, we believe in “lead by example”

  • You have a big bias for action → You are a “débrouillard”, and understand the value of speed & execution

  • Hands-on mindset: comfortable switching between strategic vision and execution

  • Strong communication skills

  • Fluency in English & French

  • Strong pragmatism and good taste for software

  • Solid knowledge of SaaS markets & mechanisms

  • Strong business acumen

  • Ability to inspire and lead teams

  • Humility, curiosity, passion and a growth mindset

Nice to have

  • Ability to easily process and synthesize information

  • Experience in Sales tech

  • High tech literacy

  • Background in Sales or Operations

  • Background in Product Management

Recruitment process

  • Interview with Victoire our Talent Acquisition Manager

  • Interview with Kévin, our VP of Product & Design

  • Interview with Mael, our CPO

  • Business Case (async.) + Live Q&A with Maël, our CPO

  • Interview with Charles, our CEO

  • Reference Check

  • Offer

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us 👇🏼

lemlist is the sales engagement platform that gives sales teams the unfair advantage they deserve.
Bootstrapped since day one, we’ve grown from 0 to $35M ARR in 6 years, without raising a single dollar.
Today, we’re a profitable B2B SaaS company valued at $150M, trusted by 40,000+ sales teams worldwide to book more meetings and close more deals.

As a Senior Product Designer at lemlist, you’ll work hand in hand with Senior Product Managers and Senior Developers across squads to deliver meaningful impact for our users. You’ll own design from problem discovery to shipping, and help shape the future of Sales tech.

You will:

  • Develop a deep understanding of our market, industry, users, company, and product vision

  • Dig beneath the surface to uncover real problems and opportunities

  • Own the delivery process with Product Managers: from discovery to launch, ensuring users feel the impact

  • Identify problems, proactively suggest improvements, and help shape the roadmap

  • Own the overall quality of the product by driving consistency, simplicity and ease of use

  • Create world-class design experiences that position lemlist as the leading software in our space

  • Be hands-on, move fast, and learn fast, whether working within a squad or shipping directly to users

  • Work and switch between multiple opportunities

  • Shape what the future of Product Design looks like (including AI)

  • Shape what the future of Sales looks like (including AI)

  • Make your role evolve based on where you believe you can create more value

We’re not looking for designers who:

  • Only deliver Figma files

  • Wait for instructions instead of being proactive

  • Are uncomfortable speaking with users or digging into real value creation

  • Don’t make user impact their priority

  • Enjoy their comfort zone

  • Spend more time in processes and complexe methodologies than bringing value to users

What’s in it for you:

  • Drive innovation in the Sales tech space

  • Work with only senior talents

  • Challenge the statut quo of the industry

  • A lot of autonomy on how your squad should thrive to be successful

  • A place where best ideas win

  • A remote friendly environment

  • A chance to work with an innovative, fast-paced team with a bias for action

Key results

Within 3 months you will have:

  • Gained a deep understanding of our product, industry, and vision

  • Built relationships with lemlist users, and have a deep understanding of them

  • Owned the entire delivery process from end to end

  • Successfully created value for users

Within 12 months you will have:

  • Launched solutions that positively impact users and the company’s revenue

  • Established yourself as an industry expert with deep insight into our customers

  • Influenced and improved the roadmap

  • Helped shape the future of lemlist and Sales prospection

Preferred experience

Must have

  • You have 4+ years of experience in Product Design. Scale-up experience is preferred.

  • You have a big bias for action → You are a “débrouillard”, and understand the value of speed & execution

  • Strong communication skills

  • Fluency in English & French

  • Strong pragmatism and good taste for software

  • Solid knowledge of SaaS markets & mechanisms

  • Strong business acumen

  • Ability to inspire and lead teams

  • Humility, curiosity, passion and a growth mindset

Nice to have

  • Ability to easily process and synthesize information

  • Experience in Sales tech

  • High tech literacy

  • Background in Sales or Operations

  • Background in Product Management

Recruitment process

  • Interview with Victoire our Talent Acquisition Manager

  • Interview with Kévin, our VP of Product & Design

  • Interview with Mael, our CPO

  • Business Case (async.) + Live Q&A with Maël & Kevin

  • Interview with Charles, our CEO

  • Reference Check

  • Offer

We value people’s work and believe the best way to assess people is by looking at their work. Whether it's real or fake work, we don’t care. We want to see what you can ship.

If you “don’t have time” to show some of your work (even a Figma link), it’s probably not the right place for you.
